summary: Emergency response safety website connecting citizens in danger with nearby police officers. Features separate authentication for citizens and police, one-tap emergency alerts with live location sharing, and real-time response system for officers to receive and respond to help requests.
architectural_notes: Implement geolocation services to calculate nearest police stations based on citizen location
Real-time WebSocket or push notification system for instant alert delivery
Role-based access control (RBAC) distinguishing citizen and police officer permissions
Mobile-responsive design prioritizing one-tap emergency access
known_issues: Role assignment error: users cannot self-select roles during registration - only author can assign roles, blocking citizen and police officer access

existing_features.title: Create a landing page with a compelling safety-focused caption and a prominent 'Check Here for Safety' button that serves as the entry point to the emergency alert system
Implement dual authentication system with separate sign-up and sign-in flows for two user types: 'People' (citizens) and 'Officer' (police)
Create user registration form that collects name and mobile number for both citizen and officer sign-ups
Implement location access request with clear permission messaging that asks 'Allow location access to check where you are' when a citizen initiates an emergency alert
Capture and transmit the citizen's exact live location to the nearest police station when they send a help request
Build a police officer dashboard that receives emergency help requests from citizens, displays their location, name, and mobile number, and allows officers to accept requests
Implement real-time notification system that alerts police officers when a new help request is received and notifies citizens when their request is accepted
Add in-app calling functionality that enables police officers to directly call the citizen's mobile number from the help request interface
Implement a messaging system that allows quick communication between citizens and responding officers
Display quick response indicators and status updates showing when police have received, accepted, and are responding to emergency requests

Apply a professional, trustworthy visual design with an urgent yet calming aesthetic suitable for an emergency response platform, using colors that convey safety and reliability, clear typography for readability under stress, and intuitive layouts that prioritize speed and clarity
Verify that the RegistrationForm component correctly passes the selected role to the backend when creating a new user profile

new_feature_requests.summary: Dual authentication system - separate sign-up/login for citizens and police officers
Emergency alert button on landing page with compelling safety caption
User registration form collecting name and mobile number
Location access permission request with clear messaging
Live location tracking and automatic dispatch to nearest police station
Police dashboard to receive, view, and accept emergency help requests
In-app calling functionality for police to contact citizens
Real-time notification system for both citizens and police
Messaging system for quick communication between citizens and police
Quick response indicators and status updates for emergency requests
Remove the role-based access control restriction that requires only the author to assign roles, and allow users to self-select their role (citizen or officer) during the registration process
Update the user profile creation logic in the backend to accept and store the user's selected role (citizen or officer) from the registration form without requiring special authorization
